sen.j: 仙石 秀範（せんごく ひでのり）は、安土桃山時代から江戸時代前期にかけての武将。
sen.e: Hidenori SENGOKU was busho (a Japanese military commander) from the Azuchi-Momoyama Period to the early Edo Period.
Hidenori SENGOKU was a busho (a Japanese military commander) from the Azuchi-Momoyama period to the early Edo period.
sen.cmt: a を挿入しました。Period→period と修正しました。
sen.e: Hidenori SENGOKU was a busho (a Japanese military commander) from the Azuchi-Momoyama period to the early Edo period.
He was a legitimate son of Hidehisa SENGOKU.
He was the legitimate son of Hidehisa SENGOKU.
He was the legitimate son of Hidehisa SENGOKU.

sen.j: 仙石秀久の次男として生まれる。
sen.e: He was born as the second son of Hidehisa SENGOKU.
He was born as the second son of Hidehisa SENGOKU.

sen.j: 慶長4年（1599年）、豊臣家から3000石 (単位)を与えられて従五位下、豊前国守に叙任された。
sen.e: In 1599, he was given 3,000 koku (unit of volume) by the Toyotomi family and appointed to Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade), Buzen no kuni no kami (Governor of Buzen Province).
In 1599, he was given 3,000 koku (unit of volume) by the Toyotomi family and appointed to Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade), Buzen no kuni no kami (Governor of Buzen Province).

sen.j: 慶長5年（1600年）の関ヶ原の戦いでは西軍に与したため、戦後、東軍に与した父から廃嫡された上に勘当されて浪人となった。
sen.e: Because he sided with the Western Camp at the Battle of Sekigahara in 1600, he became ronin (masterless samurai) after the Battle, disinherited and disowned by his father siding with the Eastern Camp.

sen.j: 出家して京都で寺子屋の講師を務めていたという。
sen.e: He entered into priesthood and served as a lecturer at terakoya (temple elementary school during the Edo period) in Kyoto.

sen.j: 慶長19年（1614年）に大坂の陣が始まると、大坂城に入って豊臣方として戦った。
sen.e: In 1614, when Osaka no Jin (the Siege of Osaka) started, he fought on Toyotomi side.
In 1614, when Osaka no Jin (the Siege of Osaka) started, he entered Osaka-jo Castle and fought on the Toyotomi side.

sen.e: In 1614, when Osaka no Jin (the Siege of Osaka) started, he entered Osaka-jo Castle and fought on the Toyotomi side.

sen.j: このとき、豊臣家から大名衆として3万石前後の所領を与えられている。
sen.e: At this time, he was given shoryo (territory) of around 30,000 koku as daimyoshu (feudal lord group) by the Toyotomi family.
sen.cmt: 「大名衆」の定訳が見つかりませんでしたので直訳しています。

sen.j: しかし翌年の夏の陣で豊臣氏の敗北が決定的となると、丹波国に逃亡した。
sen.e: When the defeat of the Toyotomi clan became clear at Osaka Natsu no Jin (the Summer Siege of Osaka) next year, however, he fled to Tanba Province.

sen.cmt: next year→in the following year と修正しました。

sen.j: その後の秀範の行方は不明である。
sen.e: After that, his whereabouts were unknown.

sen.j: 夏の陣で討死したともいわれている。
sen.e: It is said that he died in Osaka Natsu no Jin.
It is also said that he died in Osaka Natsu no Jin.

sen.j: ただし、10歳になる息子長太郎は伯耆国で捕らえられ、夏の陣後の閏6月22日に六条河原で乳母の子供と共に斬られ、晒し首にされた。
sen.e: His son, Chotaro aged 10 was captured in Hoki Province, and his head was displayed in public, decapitated together with a child of his menoto (a woman providing breast-feed to a highborn baby) in the Rokujo-gawara riverbed on intercalary June 22 after Osaka Natsu no Jin.

sen.j: ほかに徳という女子がおり、叔父の仙石忠政に預けられ、寛永12年に没した。
sen.e: He had a daughter named Toku as well who was be placed with her uncle Tadamasa SENGOKU and then died in 1635.
